GL.name: GL
GL.description: The global scope that contains all the classes from LiteGL and also all the enums of WebGL so you dont need to create a context to use the values.

gl.name: gl
gl.description: the webgl context returned by GL.create, its a WebGLRenderingContext with some extra methods added

GL.FBO.name: GL.FBO
GL.FBO.description:
FBO for FrameBufferObjects, FBOs are used to store the render inside one or several textures 
Supports multibuffer and depthbuffer texture, useful for deferred rendering

params.name: color_textures
params.description: an array containing the color textures, if not supplied a render buffer will be used

params.name: depth_texture
params.description: the depth texture, if not supplied a render buffer will be used

geo.name: geo
geo.description: Computational geometry algorithms, is a static class

BBox.name: BBox
BBox.description:
BBox is a class to create BoundingBoxes but it works as glMatrix, creating Float32Array with the info inside instead of objects
The bounding box is stored as center,halfsize,min,max,radius (total of 13 floats)

LEvent.name: LEvent
LEvent.description:
LEvent is a lightweight events library focused in low memory footprint and fast delivery.
It works by creating a property called "__levents" inside the object that has the bindings, and storing arrays with all the bindings.

GL.Indexer.name: GL.Indexer
GL.Indexer.description: Indexer used to reuse vertices among a mesh

GL.Buffer.name: GL.Buffer
GL.Buffer.description: A data buffer to be stored in the GPU

params.name: spacing
params.description: number of numbers per component (3 per vertex, 2 per uvs...), default 3

GL.Octree.name: GL.Octree
GL.Octree.description:
Octree generator for fast ray triangle collision with meshes
	Dependencies: glmatrix.js (for vector and matrix operations)

params.name: mesh
params.description: object containing vertices buffer (indices buffer optional)

GL.Shader.name: GL.Shader
GL.Shader.description: Shader class to upload programs to the GPU

params.name: vertexSource
params.description: (it also allows to pass a compiled vertex shader)

params.name: fragmentSource
params.description: (it also allows to pass a compiled fragment shader)

params.name: macros
params.description: (optional) precompiler macros to be applied when compiling

GL.Texture.name: GL.Texture
GL.Texture.description:
Texture class to upload images to the GPU, default is gl.TEXTURE_2D, gl.RGBA of gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE with filters set to gl.LINEAR and wrap to gl.CLAMP_TO_EDGE
There is a list of options
==========================
- texture_type: gl.TEXTURE_2D, gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP, default gl.TEXTURE_2D
- format: gl.RGB, gl.RGBA, gl.DEPTH_COMPONENT, default gl.RGBA
- type: gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE, gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT, gl.HALF_FLOAT_OES, gl.FLOAT, default gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE
- filter: filtering for mag and min: gl.NEAREST or gl.LINEAR, default gl.NEAREST
- magFilter: magnifying filter: gl.NEAREST, gl.LINEAR, default gl.NEAREST
- minFilter: minifying filter: gl.NEAREST, gl.LINEAR, gl.LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR, default gl.NEAREST
- wrap: texture wrapping: gl.CLAMP_TO_EDGE, gl.REPEAT, gl.MIRROR, default gl.CLAMP_TO_EDGE (also accepts wrapT and wrapS for separate settings)
- pixel_data: ArrayBufferView with the pixel data to upload to the texture, otherwise the texture will be black
- premultiply_alpha : multiply the color by the alpha value when uploading, default FALSE
- no_flip : do not flip in Y, default TRUE
- anisotropic : number of anisotropic fetches, default 0
check for more info about formats: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGLRenderingContext/texImage2D

params.name: width
params.description: texture width (any supported but Power of Two allows to have mipmaps), 0 means no memory reserved till its filled

params.name: height
params.description: texture height (any supported but Power of Two allows to have mipmaps), 0 means no memory reserved till its filled

params.name: options
params.description: Check the list in the description

classitems.description: creates a new WebGL context (it can create the canvas or use an existing one)
classitems.name: create

params.name: options
params.description:
supported are: 
- width
- height
- canvas
- container (string or element)

return.description: webgl context with all the extra functions (check gl in the doc for more info)

classitems.description: sets this context as the current global gl context (in case you have more than one)
classitems.name: makeCurrent

classitems.description: executes callback inside this webgl context
classitems.name: execute

classitems.description:
Launch animation loop (calls gl.onupdate and gl.ondraw every frame)
example: gl.ondraw = function(){ ... }   or  gl.onupdate = function(dt) { ... }
classitems.name: animate

classitems.description: Destroy this WebGL context (removes also the Canvas from the DOM)
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description:
Tells the system to capture mouse events on the canvas. 
This will trigger onmousedown, onmousemove, onmouseup, onmousewheel callbacks assigned in the gl context
example: gl.onmousedown = function(e){ ... }
The event is a regular MouseEvent with some extra parameters
classitems.name: captureMouse

classitems.description: Tells the system to capture key events on the canvas. This will trigger onkey
classitems.name: captureKeys

params.name: prevent_default
params.description: prevent default behaviour (like scroll on the web, etc)

params.name: only_canvas
params.description: only caches keyboard events if they happen when the canvas is in focus

classitems.description: Tells the system to capture gamepad events on the canvas.
classitems.name: captureGamepads

classitems.description: returns the detected gamepads on the system
classitems.name: getGamepads

params.name: skip_mapping
params.description: if set to true it returns the basic gamepad, otherwise it returns a class with mapping info to XBOX controller

classitems.description: launches de canvas in fullscreen mode
classitems.name: fullscreen

classitems.description:
returns a canvas with a snapshot of an area
this is safer than using the canvas itself due to internals of webgl
classitems.name: snapshot

classitems.description: returns a texture and caches it inside gl.textures[]
classitems.name: loadTexture

params.name: options
params.description: (same options as when creating a texture)

params.name: callback
params.description: function called once the texture is loaded

classitems.description: draws a texture to the viewport
classitems.name: drawTexture

classitems.description: use it to reset the the initial gl state
classitems.name: gl.reset

classitems.description: Tells you if the app is running on a mobile device (iOS or Android)
classitems.name: isMobile

return.description: true if is running on a iOS or Android device

classitems.description: Changes the textures binded to this FBO
classitems.name: setTextures

params.name: color_textures
params.description: an array containing the color textures, if not supplied a render buffer will be used

params.name: depth_texture
params.description: the depth texture, if not supplied a render buffer will be used

params.name: skip_disable
params.description: it doenst try to go back to the previous FBO enabled in case there was one

classitems.description: Updates the FBO with the new set of textures and buffers
classitems.name: update

params.name: skip_disable
params.description: it doenst try to go back to the previous FBO enabled in case there was one

classitems.description:
Enables this FBO (from now on all the render will be stored in the textures attached to this FBO
It stores the previous viewport to restore it afterwards, and changes it to full FBO size
classitems.name: bind

params.name: keep_old
params.description: keeps the previous FBO is one was attached to restore it afterwards

classitems.description:
Disables this FBO, if it was binded with keep_old then the old FBO is enabled, otherwise it will render to the screen
Restores viewport to previous
classitems.name: unbind

classitems.description: Returns a float4 containing the info about a plane with normal N and that passes through point P
classitems.name: createPlane

classitems.description: Computes the distance between the point and the plane
classitems.name: distancePointToPlane

classitems.description: Computes the square distance between the point and the plane
classitems.name: distance2PointToPlane

classitems.description: Projects a 3D point on a 3D line
classitems.name: projectPointOnLine

classitems.description: Projects a 2D point on a 2D line
classitems.name: project2DPointOnLine

classitems.description: Projects point on plane
classitems.name: projectPointOnPlane

classitems.description: Finds the reflected point over a plane (useful for reflecting camera position when rendering reflections)
classitems.name: reflectPointInPlane

classitems.description: test a ray plane collision and retrieves the collision point
classitems.name: testRayPlane

return.description: returns if the ray collides the plane or the ray is parallel to the plane

classitems.description: test collision between segment and plane and retrieves the collision point
classitems.name: testSegmentPlane

return.description: returns if the segment collides the plane or it is parallel to the plane

classitems.description: test a ray sphere collision and retrieves the collision point
classitems.name: testRaySphere

return.description: returns if the ray collides the sphere

classitems.description: test a ray cylinder collision and retrieves the collision point
classitems.name: testRaySphere

return.description: returns if the ray collides the cylinder

classitems.description: test a ray bounding-box collision and retrieves the collision point, the BB must be Axis Aligned
classitems.name: testRayBox

params.name: minB
params.description: minimum position of the bounding box

params.name: maxB
params.description: maximim position of the bounding box

return.description: returns if the ray collides the box

classitems.description: test a ray bounding-box collision, it uses the  BBox class and allows to use non-axis aligned bbox
classitems.name: testRayBBox

params.name: result
params.description: collision position in world space unless in_local is true

return.description: returns if the ray collides the box

classitems.description: test if a 3d point is inside a BBox
classitems.name: testPointBBox

classitems.description: test if a BBox overlaps another BBox
classitems.name: testBBoxBBox

classitems.description: test if a sphere overlaps a BBox
classitems.name: testSphereBBox

classitems.description: extract frustum planes given a view-projection matrix
classitems.name: extractPlanes

return.description: returns all 6 planes in a float32array[24]

classitems.description: test a BBox against the frustum

classitems.description: test a Sphere against the frustum
classitems.name: frustumTestSphere

classitems.description: test if a 2d point is inside a 2d polygon
classitems.name: testPoint2DInPolygon

classitems.description: create an empty bbox
classitems.name: create

return.description: returns a float32array with the bbox

classitems.description: create an bbox copy from another one
classitems.name: clone

return.description: returns a float32array with the bbox

return.description: returns a float32array with the bbox

params.name: radius

classitems.description: Binds an event to an instance
classitems.name: LEvent.bind

params.name: callback
params.description: function to call when the event is triggered

params.name: target_instance
params.description: [Optional] instance to call the function (use this instead of .bind method to help removing events)

classitems.description: Unbinds an event from an instance
classitems.name: LEvent.unbind

classitems.description: Unbinds all events from an instance (or the ones that match certain target_instance)
classitems.name: LEvent.unbindAll

params.name: target_instance
params.description: [Optional] target_instance of the events to remove

classitems.description: Unbinds all callbacks associated to one specific event from this instance
classitems.name: LEvent.unbindAll

params.name: event
params.description: name of the event you want to remove all binds

classitems.description: Tells if there is a binded callback that matches the criteria
classitems.name: LEvent.isBind

params.name: instance
params.description: where the are the events binded

classitems.description: Tells if there is any callback binded to this event
classitems.name: LEvent.hasBind

params.name: instance
params.description: where the are the events binded

return.description: true is there is at least one

classitems.description: Tells if there is any callback binded to this object pointing to a method in the target object
classitems.name: LEvent.hasBindTo

params.name: instance
params.description: where there are the events binded

return.description: true is there is at least one

classitems.description:
Triggers and event in an instance
If the callback returns true then it will stop the propagation and return true
classitems.name: LEvent.trigger

params.name: parameters
params.description: that will be received by the binded function

params.name: reverse_order
params.description: trigger in reverse order (binded last get called first)

params.name: expand_parameters
params.description:
parameters are passed not as one single parameter, but as many
return {bool} true if the event passed was blocked by any binded callback

classitems.description:
Triggers and event to every element in an array.
If the event returns true, it must be intercepted
classitems.name: LEvent.triggerArray

params.name: array
params.description: contains all instances to triggers the event

params.name: parameters
params.description: that will be received by the binded function

params.name: reverse_order
params.description: trigger in reverse order (binded last get called first)

params.name: expand_parameters
params.description:
parameters are passed not as one single parameter, but as many
return {bool} false

classitems.description: Adds the methods to bind, trigger and unbind to this class prototype
classitems.name: LEvent.extendClass

classitems.description: Applies an action to every vertex in this buffer
classitems.name: forEach

params.name: callback
params.description: to be called for every vertex (or whatever is contained in the buffer)

classitems.description:
Applies a mat4 transform to every triplets in the buffer (assuming they are points)
No upload is performed (to ensure efficiency in case there are several operations performed)
classitems.name: applyTransform

classitems.description: Uploads the buffer data (stored in this.data) to the GPU

classitems.description: Assign data to buffer and uploads it (it allows range)

classitems.description: Uploads part of the buffer data (stored in this.data) to the GPU
classitems.name: uploadRange

classitems.description: Clones one buffer (it allows to share the same data between both buffers)
classitems.name: clone

params.name: share
params.description:
if you want that both buffers share the same data (default false)
return {GL.Buffer} buffer cloned

classitems.description: Deletes the content from the GPU and destroys the handler

params.name: vertexBuffers

params.name: indexBuffers

classitems.description: Creates a new empty buffer and attachs it to this mesh

params.name: attribute

params.name: buffer_data
params.description: the data in typed array format [optional, if ommited it created an empty array of getNumVertices() * spacing]

classitems.description: Updates a vertex buffer

params.name: attribute
params.description: the name of the attribute in the shader

params.name: spacing
params.description: number of numbers per component (3 per vertex, 2 per uvs...), default 3

params.name: data
params.description: the array with all the data

classitems.description: Removes a vertex buffer from the mesh

params.name: free
params.description: if you want to remove the data from the GPU

classitems.description: Returns a vertex buffer

classitems.description: Creates a new empty index buffer and attachs it to this mesh

classitems.description: Returns a vertex buffer
classitems.name: getBuffer

classitems.description: Returns a index buffer

classitems.description: Removes an index buffer from the mesh

params.name: free
params.description: if you want to remove the data from the GPU

classitems.description: Uploads data inside buffers to VRAM.
classitems.name: upload

classitems.description: Creates a clone of the mesh, the datarrays are cloned too
classitems.name: clone

classitems.description: Creates a clone of the mesh, but the data-arrays are shared between both meshes (useful for sharing a mesh between contexts)

classitems.description: Creates an object with the info of the mesh (useful to transfer to workers)

classitems.description: Computes some data about the mesh

classitems.description: Creates a new index stream with wireframe

classitems.description: Multiplies every normal by -1 and uploads it

classitems.description: Compute indices for a mesh where vertices are shared

classitems.description: Breaks the indices

classitems.description: Creates a stream with the normals
classitems.name: computeNormals

classitems.description: Creates a new stream with the tangents
classitems.name: computeTangents

classitems.description: Creates texture coordinates using a triplanar aproximation

classitems.description: Computes the number of vertices
classitems.name: getVertexNumber

classitems.description: Computes bounding information

classitems.description: returns the bounding box, if it is not computed, then computes it

classitems.description: forces a bounding box to be set

params.name: half_size
params.description: vector from the center to positive corner

classitems.description: Remove all local memory from the streams (leaving it only in the VRAM) to save RAM
classitems.name: freeData

classitems.description: Returns the amount of memory used by this mesh in bytes (sum of all buffers)
classitems.name: getMemory

classitems.description: returns a low poly version of the mesh that takes much less memory (but breaks tiling of uvs and smoothing groups)
classitems.name: simplify

classitems.description: Static method for the class Mesh to create a mesh from a list of common streams
classitems.name: Mesh.load

params.name: output_mesh
params.description: [optional] mesh to store the mesh, otherwise is created

params.name: gl
params.description: [optional] if omitted, the global.gl is used

classitems.description: Returns a mesh with all the meshes merged (you can apply transforms individually to every buffer)
classitems.name: Mesh.mergeMeshes

params.name: meshes
params.description: array containing object like { mesh:, matrix:, texture_matrix: }

params.name: options
params.description: { only_data: to get the mesh data without uploading it }

return.description: the mesh in GL.Mesh format or Object format (if options.only_data is true)

classitems.description: Returns am empty mesh and loads a mesh and parses it using the Mesh.parsers, by default only OBJ is supported
classitems.name: Mesh.fromOBJ

classitems.description:
given some data an information about the format, it search for a parser in Mesh.parsers and tries to extract the mesh information
Only obj supported now
classitems.name: parse

classitems.description:
It returns the mesh data encoded in the format specified
Only obj supported now
classitems.name: encode

classitems.description:
Returns a shared mesh containing a quad to be used when rendering to the screen
Reusing the same quad helps not filling the memory

classitems.description: test collision between sphere and the triangles in the octree (only test if there is any vertex inside the sphere)

return.description: true if the sphere collided with the mesh

classitems.description: Parses a OBJ string and returns an object with the info ready to be passed to GL.Mesh.load
classitems.name: Mesh.parseOBJ

params.name: data
params.description: all the OBJ info to be parsed

classitems.description: Returns a planar mesh (you can choose how many subdivisions)

params.name: options
params.description: valid options: detail, detailX, detailY, size, width, heigth, xz (horizontal plane)

classitems.description: Returns a point mesh

classitems.description: Returns a sphere mesh

params.name: options

classitems.description: Returns a grid mesh (must be rendered using gl.LINES)

classitems.description: Returns a icosahedron mesh (useful to create spheres by subdivision)
classitems.name: Mesh.icosahedron

classitems.description:
Compiles one single shader source (could be gl.VERTEX_SHADER or gl.FRAGMENT_SHADER) and returns the webgl shader handler 
Used internaly to compile the vertex and fragment shader.
It throws an exception if there is any error in the code
classitems.name: Shader.compileSource

classitems.description: It updates the code inside one shader
classitems.name: updateShader

classitems.description:
It extract all the info about the compiled shader program, all the info about uniforms and attributes.
This info is stored so it works faster during rendering.
classitems.name: extractShaderInfo

classitems.description: Returns if this shader has a uniform with the given name
classitems.name: hasUniform

classitems.description: Returns if this shader has an attribute with the given name
classitems.name: hasAttribute

classitems.description:
Tells you which function to call when uploading a uniform according to the data type in the shader
Used internally from extractShaderInfo to optimize calls
classitems.name: Shader.getUniformFunc

classitems.description: Create a shader from two urls. While the system is fetching the two urls, the shader contains a dummy shader that renders black.
classitems.name: Shader.fromURL

params.name: vs_path
params.description: the url to the vertex shader

params.name: fs_path
params.description: the url to the fragment shader

params.name: on_complete
params.description: [Optional] a callback to call once the shader is ready.

classitems.description: enables the shader (calls useProgram)
classitems.name: bind

classitems.description: Returns the location of a uniform or attribute
classitems.name: getLocation

classitems.description: Uploads a set of uniforms to the Shader. You dont need to specify types, they are infered from the shader info.
classitems.name: uniforms

classitems.description: Uploads a uniform to the Shader. You dont need to specify types, they are infered from the shader info. Shader must be binded!
classitems.name: setUniform

classitems.description: Renders a mesh using this shader, remember to use the function uniforms before to enable the shader
classitems.name: draw

params.name: mode
params.description: could be gl.LINES, gl.POINTS, gl.TRIANGLES, gl.TRIANGLE_STRIP, gl.TRIANGLE_FAN

params.name: index_buffer_name
params.description: the name of the index buffer, if not provided triangles will be assumed

classitems.description: Renders a range of a mesh using this shader
classitems.name: drawRange

params.name: mode
params.description: could be gl.LINES, gl.POINTS, gl.TRIANGLES, gl.TRIANGLE_STRIP, gl.TRIANGLE_FAN

params.name: index_buffer_name
params.description: the name of the index buffer, if not provided triangles will be assumed

classitems.description: Renders a range of a mesh using this shader
classitems.name: drawBuffers

params.name: vertexBuffers
params.description: an object containing all the buffers

params.name: mode
params.description: could be gl.LINES, gl.POINTS, gl.TRIANGLES, gl.TRIANGLE_STRIP, gl.TRIANGLE_FAN

classitems.description:
Given a source code with the directive #import it expands it inserting the code using Shader.files to fetch for import files.
Warning: Imports are evaluated only the first inclusion, the rest are ignored to avoid double inclusion of functions
         Also, imports cannot have other imports inside.
classitems.name: Shader.expandImports

params.name: files
params.description: [Optional] object with files to import from (otherwise Shader.files is used)

return.description: the code with the lines #import removed and replaced by the code

classitems.description: Allows to create a simple shader meant to be used to process a texture, instead of having to define the generic Vertex & Fragment Shader code
classitems.name: Shader.createFX

params.name: uniforms
params.description: string containg extra uniforms, like "uniform vec3 u_pos;"

classitems.description: Renders a fullscreen quad with this shader applied
classitems.name: toViewport

classitems.description:
Returns a shader ready to render a textured quad in fullscreen, use with Mesh.getScreenQuad() mesh
shader params sampler2D u_texture
classitems.name: Shader.getScreenShader

classitems.description:
Returns a shader ready to render a colored textured quad in fullscreen, use with Mesh.getScreenQuad() mesh
shader params vec4 u_color and sampler2D u_texture
classitems.name: Shader.getColoredScreenShader

classitems.description:
Returns a shader ready to render a quad with transform, use with Mesh.getScreenQuad() mesh
shader must have: u_position, u_size, u_viewport, u_transform (mat3)
classitems.name: Shader.getQuadShader

classitems.description:
Returns a shader ready to render part of a texture into the viewport
shader must have: u_position, u_size, u_viewport, u_transform, u_texture_area (vec4)
classitems.name: Shader.getPartialQuadShader

classitems.description:
Returns a shader that blends two textures
shader must have: u_factor, u_texture, u_texture2
classitems.name: Shader.getBlendShader

classitems.description:
Returns a shader used to apply gaussian blur to one texture in one axis (you should use it twice to get a gaussian blur)
shader params are: vec2 u_offset, float u_intensity
classitems.name: Shader.getBlurShader

classitems.description:
Returns a shader to apply FXAA antialiasing
params are vec2 u_viewportSize, vec2 u_iViewportSize or you can call shader.setup()
classitems.name: Shader.getFXAAShader

classitems.description: Returns a flat shader (useful to render lines)
classitems.name: Shader.getFlatShader

classitems.description: Free the texture memory from the GPU, sets the texture handler to null
classitems.name: delete

classitems.description: Returns if depth texture is supported by the GPU
classitems.name: isDepthSupported

classitems.description: Binds the texture to one texture unit
classitems.name: bind

classitems.description: Unbinds the texture
classitems.name: unbind

classitems.description: Unbinds the texture
classitems.name: Texture.setUploadOptions

params.name: options
params.description:
a list of options to upload the texture
- premultiply_alpha : multiply the color by the alpha value, default FALSE
- no_flip : do not flip in Y, default TRUE

classitems.description: Given an Image/Canvas/Video it uploads it to the GPU
classitems.name: uploadImage

classitems.description: Uploads data to the GPU (data must have the appropiate size)
classitems.name: uploadData

classitems.description:
Render to texture using FBO, just pass the callback to a rendering function and the content of the texture will be updated
If the texture is a cubemap, the callback will be called six times, once per face, the number of the face is passed as a second parameter
for further info about how to set up the propper cubemap camera, check the GL.Texture.cubemap_camera_parameters with the direction and up vector for every face.

Keep in mind that it tries to reuse the last renderbuffer for the depth, and if it cannot (different size) it creates a new one (throwing the old)
classitems.name: drawTo

params.name: callback
params.description: function that does all the rendering inside this texture

classitems.description: Static version of drawTo meant to be used with several buffers
classitems.name: drawToColorAndDepth

classitems.description: Similar to drawTo but it also stores the depth in a depth texture
classitems.name: drawToColorAndDepth

classitems.description:
Copy content of one texture into another
TODO: check using copyTexImage2D
classitems.name: copyTo

params.name: shader
params.description: optional shader to apply while copying

classitems.description: Render texture in a quad to full viewport size
classitems.name: toViewport

params.name: shader
params.description: to apply, otherwise a default textured shader is applied [optional]

classitems.description: Fills the texture with a constant color (uses gl.clear)
classitems.name: fill

params.name: skip_mipmaps
params.description: if true the mipmaps wont be updated

classitems.description: Render texture in a quad of specified area
classitems.name: renderQuad

classitems.description: Applies a blur filter of four pixels to the texture (be careful using it, it is slow)
classitems.name: applyBlur

params.name: offsetx
params.description: scalar that multiplies the offset when fetching pixels horizontally (default 1)

params.name: offsety
params.description: scalar that multiplies the offset when fetching pixels vertically (default 1)

params.name: temp_texture
params.description: blur needs a temp texture, if not supplied it will create a new one each time!

params.name: output_texture
params.description: [optional] if not passed the output is the own texture

return.description: returns the temp_texture in case you want to reuse it

classitems.description: Loads and uploads a texture from a url
classitems.name: Texture.fromURL

classitems.description: Create a texture from an Image
classitems.name: Texture.fromImage

classitems.description: Create a texture from a Video
classitems.name: Texture.fromVideo

classitems.description: Create a clone of a texture
classitems.name: Texture.fromTexture

classitems.description: Create a texture from an ArrayBuffer containing the pixels
classitems.name: Texture.fromTexture

classitems.description: Create a texture from an ArrayBuffer containing the pixels
classitems.name: Texture.fromDDSInMemory

classitems.description: Create a generative texture from a shader ( must GL.Shader.getScreenShader as reference for the shader )
classitems.name: Texture.fromShader

classitems.description: Create a cubemap texture from a set of 6 images
classitems.name: Texture.cubemapFromImages

classitems.description:
Create a cubemap texture from a single image that contains all six images 
If it is a cross, it must be horizontally aligned, and options.is_cross must be equal to the column where the top and bottom are located (usually 1 or 2)
otherwise it assumes the 6 images are arranged vertically, in the order of OpenGL: +X, -X, +Y, -Y, +Z, -Z
classitems.name: Texture.cubemapFromImage

classitems.description: Given the width and the height of an image, and in which column is the top and bottom sides of the cubemap, it gets the info to pass to Texture.cubemapFromImage in options.faces
classitems.name: Texture.generateCubemapCrossFaces

params.name: width
params.description: of the CROSS image (not the side image)

params.name: column
params.description: the column where the top and the bottom is located

return.description: object to pass to Texture.cubemapFromImage in options.faces

classitems.name: Texture.cubemapFromURL

classitems.description: returns an ArrayBuffer with the pixels in the texture, they are fliped in Y
classitems.name: getPixels

params.name: type
params.description: gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE or gl.FLOAT, if omited then the one in the texture is read

params.name: force_rgba
params.description: if yo want to force the output to have 4 components per pixel (useful to transfer to canvas)

classitems.description: Copy texture content to a canvas
classitems.name: toCanvas

params.name: canvas
params.description: must have the same size, if different the canvas will be resized

params.name: max_size
params.description: optional, if it is supplied the canvas wont be bigger of max_size (the image will be scaled down)

classitems.description: returns the texture file in binary format
classitems.name: toBinary

return.description: the arraybuffer of the file containing the image

classitems.description: returns a Blob containing all the data from the texture
classitems.name: toBlob

classitems.description: returns a base64 String containing all the data from the texture
classitems.name: toBase64

params.name: flip_y
params.description: if you want to flip vertically the image, WebGL saves the images upside down

classitems.description: generates some basic metadata about the image
classitems.name: generateMetadata

classitems.description: blends texture A and B and stores the result in OUT
classitems.name: blend

classitems.description: returns a white texture of 1x1 pixel
classitems.name: Texture.getWhiteTexture

classitems.description: returns a black texture of 1x1 pixel
classitems.name: Texture.getBlackTexture

classitems.description: Returns a texture from the texture pool, if none matches the specifications it creates one
classitems.name: Texture.getTemporary

return.description: the textures that matches this settings

classitems.description: Given a texture it adds it to the texture pool so it can be reused in the future
classitems.name: Texture.releaseTemporary

classitems.description: Tells if one number is power of two (used for textures)
classitems.name: isPowerOfTwo

classitems.description: Get current time in milliseconds
classitems.name: getTime

classitems.description: clone one object recursively, only allows objects containing number,strings,typed-arrays or other objects
classitems.name: cloneObject

params.name: target
params.description: if omited an empty object is created
